title: El Camino A Breaking Bad Movie almost ended very differently for Jesse Pinkman
text:

Spoiler warning for El Camino: A Breaking Bad Movie

Breaking Bad fans thought they'd probably never find out more about where the life of Jesse Pinkman ( Aaron Paul ) ended up after the finale of the acclaimed crime drama, but El Camino: A Breaking Bad Movie gave him a more conclusive end.

The Netflix film focused on Jesse's journey after he escaped his neo-Nazi captors at the conclusion of Breaking Bad, seeing him become a fugitive before eventually finding a new life and new identity in the mountains of Alaska, thanks to aid from Ed Galbraith ( the late Robert Forster ).

However, Breaking Bad creator Vince Gilligan revealed that it almost ended very differently for Jesse.

Speaking to Entertainment Weekly , Gilligan said: "I thought it was up to the audience to figure out how Jesse got away, but that it was enough to see him driving off into the night victorious.

"But then as the years started to pass, I found myself wondering at idle moments, 'How exactly did he get away? Because that's no easy feat! And what if he didn't get away? What if he got busted right around the next corner?'"

(Image: Ben Rothstein/Netflix)

He explained that one idea for how his story ended saw Jesse end up in prison.

"I didn't get super far down the road, but it was probably going to be a young woman who needed some help. He was hiding out by the Canadian border and this woman was working at a motel as a housekeeper or something.

"[He] goes into the process of saving her, knowing full well that he's going to suffer for it, he's going to get caught for it, but he does it anyway. And the last scene would be maybe him in a jail cell but at peace for the first time since the movie began."

(Image: YOUTUBE/NETFLIX)

Thankfully, Gilligan was dissuaded, but there was another idea in the offing too, according to Aaron Paul, which saw the audience hear Jesse's letter to Brock Cantillo.

Paul told EW: "Originally the voiceover of that letter was how the movie ended – just driving through Alaska and you could hear what was inside of that letter… It's heartbreaking, it's beautiful, just honest.

"But Vince just thought, 'You know what? Maybe it's best left unknown'. And we don't need it. He was right."

El Camino: A Breaking Bad Movie is available now on Netflix.

Do you think El Camino ended Jesse Pinkman's story in the right way? Let us know in the comments below.
description: SPOILERS: El Camino appeared to end the story of Jesse Pinkman that began in Breaking Bad
